au.edu.federation.caliko

Class FabrikJoint2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.edu.federation.caliko.FabrikJoint2D

  • public class FabrikJoint2D
extends Object
    Class to represent a joint used to constrain the relative angle between FabrikBone2D objects in an IK chain.

    A FabrikJoint2D consists of a pair of constraint angles, which are:

    • A clockwise constraint angle, and
    • An anticlockwise constraint angle.

    Both of these angles are specified in degrees, and are kept within the range 0 degrees to 180 degrees inclusive. The default value of these angles is 180 degrees, which means that the joint does not enforce any rotational constraints. To enforce joint constraints, the mClockwiseConstraintDegs and mAnticlockwiseConstraintDegs properties may be set via the setClockwiseConstraintDegs(float) and setAnticlockwiseConstraintDegs(float) methods, or alternatively on a FabrikBone2D through identically named methods.

    Each FabrikBone2D contains precisely one FabrikJoint2D object, which does not have a specific location, but can be considered to be attached to the mStartLocation of the bone. That a bone only contains a single joint may seem unintuitive at first, as when you think about bones in your arms or legs, most bones are connected at two points i.e. with a connection at each end. However, if you imagine working from a blank slate and adding a single bone to an IK chain, then that first bone has a single joint at its base (i.e. start location) and there is no joint at it's tip (i.e. end location).

    Following on from this, adding a second bone to the chain adds with it a second joint, which again can be thought of as being located at the start location of that second bone (which itself is at the end location of the first bone). In this way we avoid having redundant joints (i.e. 2 bones? 4 joints!), and by using the joint of the outer bone to constrain any inner bone during the FABRIK algorithm's 'forward pass', and the bone's own joint when traversing the IK chain during the 'backward pass', the correct constraints are enforced between the relative angles of any pair of adjacent bones.

    As there is only one type of joint available when working with a FabrikBone2D, it would have been perfectly possible to incorporate the joint functionality directly into the FabrikBone2D class. However, as the FabrikBone3D class allows joints to be of different types, to keep the conventions the same across the 2D and 3D aspects of the Caliko library, this separate joint class was created.

    Version:
    0.8 - 16/12/2015
    Author:
    Al Lansley

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static float MAX_2D_CONSTRAINT_ANGLE_DEGS
      The maximum valid constraint angle for both clockwise and anticlockwise rotation is 180 degrees.
      static float MIN_2D_CONSTRAINT_ANGLE_DEGS
      The minimum valid constraint angle for both clockwise and anticlockwise rotation is 0 degrees.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FabrikJoint2D

        public FabrikJoint2D()
        Default constructor.

        The clockwise and anticlockwise constraint angles are set to default values of 180 degrees, which means the bone is not constrained in its rotation. To specify joint constraints, use the setClockwiseConstraintDegs(float) and setAnticlockwiseConstraintDegs(float) methods.

      • FabrikJoint2D

        public FabrikJoint2D(float clockwiseConstraintDegs,
                     float antiClockwiseConstraintDegs)
        Two parameter constructor which sets the constraint angles.

        Constraint angles should be specified in the valid range 0.0f to 180.0f inclusive. Values outside of this range will be clamped to be within it.

        Parameters:
        clockwiseConstraintDegs - The clockwise constraint angle specified in degrees.
        antiClockwiseConstraintDegs - The anticlockwise constraint angle specified in degrees.

    • Method Detail

      • set

        public void set(FabrikJoint2D sourceJoint)
        Set the constraint angles of this FabrikJoint2D to match those of a source FabrikJoint2D, essentially making a copy of the source joint.
        Parameters:
        sourceJoint - The source joint from which to copy values.

      • setClockwiseConstraintDegs

        public void setClockwiseConstraintDegs(float angleDegs)
        Set the clockwise constraint angle of this joint in degrees.

        The constraint angle is clamped to be within the valid range of 0.0 degrees (fully constrained) to 180.0 degrees (unconstrained) inclusive.

        Parameters:
        angleDegs - The clockwise constraint angle specified in degrees.

      • setAnticlockwiseConstraintDegs

        public void setAnticlockwiseConstraintDegs(float angleDegs)
        Set the anticlockwise constraint angle of this joint in degrees.

        The constraint angle is clamped to be within the valid range of 0.0 degrees (fully constrained) to 180.0 degrees (unconstrained) inclusive.

        Parameters:
        angleDegs - The anticlockwise constraint angle specified in degrees.

      • getClockwiseConstraintDegs

        public float getClockwiseConstraintDegs()

        The clockwise constraint angle of this joint in degrees.
